problem.title: CheckPoint: Maximum Height
problem.script:
deg2rad = math.pi/180.0
m=random.choice([0.8,1.2,2.0]) k=random.choice([400,600,800]) theta=random.choice([20,30,40]) x=random.choice([0.12,0.15,0.22]) mu=random.choice([0.1,0.2,0.3])
h=0.5* k* x* x/( m*9.8*(1+ mu/math.tan( deg2rad* theta)))
problem.p: A small block of mass $m kg is launched by a compressed spring with force constant k=$k N/m. The initial compression of the spring is $x m. The block slides along a horizontal frictionless surface and then up an inclined plane that makes an angle \(\theta = $theta^{\circ}\) with the horizontal. The coefficient of kinetic friction between the block and the inclined plane is \(\mu_k = $mu\). Use \( g = 9.8 m/s^2 \).
Find the maximum vertical height h reached by the block.
